data.title: Wordwrap not working after turning "on"
data.body:
Hi,

I've set *wordWrap* to be permanently on by having this `"editor.wordWrap": "on"` in my user's settings.

After this, when I try to use the horizontal scrolling feature of my Laptop's trackpad in the editor, the horizontal scroll back comes back again, but this time the words are wrapped with unneccessary spaces not wrapped.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set "wordWrap" to "on"
2. Use horizontal Scrolling feature of Laptop to scroll in editor which has a file with codes open

![wordwrap issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20375577/29752930-1298320e-8b5f-11e7-8396-7cd258c9907c.png)

data.title: Add weight/priority to autocomplete
data.body:
Just wrote a `console.log($1)` snippet with the `cl` prefix.

When I type `cl` I get autocomplete options for a billion things with `class` being the first. My actual snippet is far down in the list.

Is there a way to assign weight to autocomplete things (like snippets) so `cl` is at the top of the list? If not, can this be converted to a feature request?

In lieu of that feature, is autocomplete intelligent and will figure out what you frequently use and increase its weight? If not, can I feature request that?

data.title: remove unwanted space
PHP code formatting
data.body: Code formatting (shift+alt+f) does not work for PHP files (with php extension installed). There is no plugin with this feature.

data.title: Missing "Set Explorer's Views Configuration as Default" option

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It's cool that we can customize which and in what order explorer's views are displayed, but I switch between tens of projects, and without an option for setting the current layout for every project this feature becomes unusable, I can't spend an afternoon setting the same layout for every project, only to find out that I have to do it all over again if I ever decide to change it.

I hope you would consider an option for making the current configuration the default one across all projects.

data.title: code --workspace option

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It's currently possible to execute something like `code ~/path1 ~/path2` and two different windows will be opened.

With the advent of multi-root I find it appropriate to have a `--workspace` option that will cause those paths to be opened in a single window.

This option would also be useful for extensions:
- [Projects+](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=fabiospampinato.vscode-projects-plus): it might be interesting to have the option to open all the projects under a group in a new workspace, without messing around with `Add Folder to Workspace...` commands and `.code-workspace` files.

data.title: Emmet custom snippets no longer working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.12.6

Since the release of Emmet 2.0, my custom snippets no longer work. As a pared down example:

```json
{
	"xml": {
		"snippets": {
			"xml": "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>"
		}
	}
}
```

Using the above, the snippet doesn't work. It worked perfectly alongside many others pre Emmet 2.0.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the custom emmet `snippets.json` file, and declare that folder location in the settings
2. Set new file language to xml.
3. Use snippet `xml`, nothing happens.
4. Set Emmet to use tab for auto completion.
5. Use snippet `xml` and press tab, nothing happens.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

The release of Emmet 2.0 has severely ruined my productivity and my opinion is that the changes implemented were a very bad idea without much more user feedback. You changed a system that has worked fine in many many editors for nearly a decade.

Unable to bind Cmd+` in key bindings
data.body:

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.16.0-insider (1.16.0-insider)
- OS Version:
macOS High Sierra Beta7
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Press <kbd>cmd</kbd>+<kbd>k</kbd> <kbd>cmd</kbd>+<kbd>s</kbd>
2. Bind <kbd>cmd</kbd>+<kbd>`</kbd> to any command

Only <kbd>cmd</kbd> is displayed. I have disabled "Move focus to next window" option in the OS keyboard shortcuts settings, so nothing is intercepting that key combination. And I can register that key binding in atom.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Fix comment in User Settings for the Minimap
data.body:
Refs: #33192 

I would like to suggest fixing the comment in User Settings to provide a list of possible values available for the Editor Minimap Showsliders option.

Currently:

	// Controls whether the minimap slider is automatically hidden.
	"editor.minimap.showSlider": "always",

With this modification:

	// Controls whether the minimap slider is automatically hidden. Possible values are 'always' and 'mouseover'
	"editor.minimap.showSlider": "always",

data.title: switching between editor tabs scrolls down past cursor repeatedly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:05:38.342Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
mono-debug|ms-|0.15.7
unity-debug|Uni|1.2.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a file with Ctrl+P.  put cursor on line 100, and center line 100 on screen.  note the top line number.
2. open another file with Ctrl+P.  put cursor on line 100, and center line 100 on screen.  note the top line number.
3. click on the tab for the first file.  cursor will not be visible as line 100 will be scrolled off the top of the screen, top line will be anywhere from 20 to 120 lines greater than it was before.
4. click on the tab for second file.  cursor will cursor will not be visible as line 100 will be scrolled off the top of the screen, anywhere from 20 to 120 lines greater than it was before.
5. click on the tab for the first file again.  note that each time you click back to a tab, it has scrolled even farther from the cursor and what was last visible, leaving you to search for whatever the heck you were just reading when you went to reference another file.  

this is really annoying.


 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Fix comment in User Settings for the Minimap
data.body:
I would like to suggest fixing the comment in User Settings to provide a list of possible values available for the Editor Minimap Showsliders option.

Currently:

	// Controls whether the minimap slider is automatically hidden.
	"editor.minimap.showSlider": "always",

With this modification:

	// Controls whether the minimap slider is automatically hidden. Possible values are 'always' and 'mouseover'
	"editor.minimap.showSlider": "always",

data.title: Revert extensionHost process.kill fix, once we use Electron with Node 8
data.body:
See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/32990

This can probably be reverted, once Electron is using Node 8.

data.title: Allow 'position' to be set in ThemableDecorationAttachmentRenderOptions
data.body:
Currently, `position` can not be set in `ThemableDecorationAttachmentRenderOptions`, this means that any `::after` and `::before` is confined to the exact height of the character.

This is noteworthy for popular extensions such as easymotion and all its clones, that attempt to highlight a certain character with a background - the visually obvious way would be to draw a selection box just like VSC does itself(one that is as high as the line, not as high as the character), but this seems to be impossible (unless I have overlooked something).

Simply supporting `position` to be set, even just to `relative` would make this possible and dramatically enhance the visual fidelity of these extensions and likely a few more.

data.title: feature-request: Sync my extensions between to systems (Mac <--> Windows)
data.body:
Hi,

I am using Mac and Windows at Work/Home. I have VS code in both. 
If we have a feature to sync all extensions between both systems. That will be very good. 

Something like Visual Studio theme sync. 

And give the option to install button in the Web site to push extensions to all systems, the user logged in. (Like Android/WP store)

Thank you,
Naga Harish.

standard|shi|0.2.3



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file (⌘N)
2. Type some content in this file and save it (⌘S)
3. Edit the file and do not save it
4. Delete the file you just opened using Finder (⌘delete) and note that 'deleted from disk' shows up in the tab that the file is open in VS Code.
5. Restore the deleted file using Finder (⌘Z)
6. The 'deleted from disk' label still visible even if you edit the file and save it again.
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Settings to make Preview behave as if it were hovered
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: July 2017 (Version 1.15), 64-bit
- OS Version: Windows 10 64-bit

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a text file. The preview section is not hovered

![preview-no-hover](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13993613/29742685-05ac1950-8a49-11e7-965f-ea8a43d01c87.png)

2. Open a text file. Hover a mouse over the preview section. The current text area is displayed with a white/gray background in the preview section.

![preview-hovered](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13993613/29742680-feb7b262-8a48-11e7-9795-0ffd627a6fba.png)

Question:

I'm wondering if there is a setting to make the preview section always be displayed as in the second picture without the need of hovering a mouse. This will make it easy for users to identify where they are located easily.

I am opening an issue here instead of StackOverFlow because I feel like this was how it worked before, but I could be wrong. Please let me know if this issue should be posted on StackOverFlow instead.

Thanks in advance.

data.title: Additional predefined variables for substitution in launch.json

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Could a ${relativeDir} variable be added which gives the directory of the file, relative to ${workspaceRoot}? i.e. ${relativefile%${filebasename}}. This would be useful in launch.json and related files (eg. tasks.json).
